intro: Faramea campanella, commonly known as the bell-shaped faramea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its ornamental, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Faramea campanella is valued for its aesthetic appeal and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
